intro: [WRONG START] Tragopopogon porrifolius subsp. angustifolium, commonly known as slenderleaf thistle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which are followed by elongated, spiny seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the Asteraceae family.
